usefulItems: plastic wrap, large bowl, kitchen towel, baking dish (32 x 22 x 7 cm), baking paper, oven
title: Brioche slice with crumble

ingredients.content: 100 g unsalted butter, cut into cubes, plus extra for greasing
250 - 300 g seasonal fruit (e.g. blueberries, strawberries, rhubarb), cut into pieces

preparations.content: Place all crumble ingredients into mixing bowl and mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer into a bowl, cover and set aside.
Place milk, yeast, sugar and vanilla sugar into mixing bowl and warm <b>2 min 30 sec/37°C/speed 1<b>.
Add flour, butter, eggs and salt and knead <b>2 min/<b>.
Transfer dough into a large bowl, cover with a kitchen towel and leave to prove in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour).

Preheat oven to 150°C. Grease and line a baking dish (32 x 22 x 7 cm) with baking paper. Transfer dough into baking dish then, using wet hands, spread and lightly press dough evenly into dish. Top dough with seasonal fruit or a thick layer of jam, then evenly sprinkle reserved crumble mixture over.

Bake for 30 minutes (150°C), then increase oven temperature to 180°C and bake for a further 15 minutes (180°C), or until golden brown. Leave slice to cool completely before cutting into pieces and serving.

hintsAndTricks: For a stronger flavour to your dough, replace 110 g of the full cream milk with 110 g of natural yoghurt or buttermilk in step 1.
This slice is best served on the day you make it.
This is a versatile slice that you can use any seasonal fruit, jam or marmalade of choice in. If using seasonal fruit, ensure any larger fruit is cut into pieces.
